sen.j: 水無月祓（みなづきばらい）は能の演目である。
sen.e: Minazukibarai is a Noh play.
Minazukibarai is a Noh play.
Minazukibarai is a Noh play.

sen.j: 作者は世阿弥とされることが多い。
sen.e: A writer of the play is regarded as Zeami in most cases.
A writer of the play is regarded as Zeami in most cases.
A writer of the play is regarded as Zeami in most cases.

sen.j: お互いに恋慕しながら別離した男女が、賀茂御祖神社の夏越の祓で再会するというハッピーエンドの作品である。
sen.e: It is a happy-ending story: A man and a woman who fell in love with each other but broke up meet again at the Nagoshi no harai (Annual Shinto ritual of purification) of Kamomioya-jinja Shrine.
It is a happy-ending story: A man and a woman who fell in love with each other but broke up meet again at the Nagoshi no harai (Annual Shinto ritual of purification) of Kamomioya-jinja Shrine.
It is a happy-ending story: A man and a woman who fell in love with each other but broke up meet again at the Nagoshi no harai (Annual Shinto ritual of purification) of Kamomioya-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 作者については、世阿弥の著書『五音』に世阿弥作の扱いで書かれており、またこの曲に比定される｢ミソギ川｣の名が、同じく世阿弥の『五音曲条々』に見える。
sen.e: As for a writer of this Noh play, Zeam's name is written in his "Goon" (Five Sounds) as if he was a writer, and the name of 'Misogi-gawa River' identified as this music is seen also in his "Goongyokujojo" (Various Matters Concerning the Five Modes of Musical Expression).

As for a writer of this Noh play, Zeami's name is written in his "Goon" (Five Sounds) as if he was a writer, and the name of 'Misogi-gawa River' identified as this music is seen also in his "Goongyokujojo" (Various Matters Concerning the Five Modes of Musical Expression).

As for a writer of this Noh play, Zeami's name is written in his "Goon" (Five Sounds) as if he was a writer, and the name of 'Misogi-gawa River' identified as this music is seen also in his "Goongyokujojo" (Various Matters Concerning the Five Modes of Musical Expression).

sen.j: ただし『二百十番謡目録』には日吉安清の作とされている。
sen.e: However, in "Nihyakujuban Utai Mokuroku" (Catalog of 210 numbers of Noh theater lyrics), it is regarded as Yasukiyo HIYOSHI's work.
However, in "Nihyakujuban Utai Mokuroku" (Catalog of 210 numbers of Noh theater lyrics), it is regarded as Yasukiyo HIYOSHI's work.
However, in "Nihyakujuban Utai Mokuroku" (Catalog of 210 numbers of Noh theater lyrics), it is regarded as Yasukiyo HIYOSHI's work.

sen.j: 江戸時代には、数少ない例外を除いて上演が途絶えていたが、江戸末期に復曲され、2006年現在では能観世流でのみ上演されている。
sen.e: In the Edo period, it was not performed except for a few occasions, but recomposed at the end of the Edo period, now in 2006 it is performed only by the Noh kanze-ryu school.
In the Edo period, it was not performed except for a few occasions, but recomposed at the end of the Edo period, now in 2006 it is performed only by the Noh kanze-ryu school.
In the Edo period, it was not performed except for a few occasions, but recomposed at the end of the Edo period, now in 2006 it is performed only by the Noh kanze-ryu school.

sen.j: 播磨国室津の遊女と京都下京に住む男との恋を主題に、下賀茂神社の故事をとりいれ、物狂いの見せ場もある夏の能である。
sen.e: It is a Noh play for summer which deals with a love romance between a prostitute of Murotsu of Harima Province and a man who lives in Shimogyo district of Kyoto, and also has a highlight scene of insanity, introducing a historical event at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine.

It is a Noh play for summer which deals with a love romance between a prostitute of Murotsu of Harima Province and a man who lives in Shimogyo district of Kyoto, and also has a highlight scene of insanity, introducing a historical event at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine.

It is a Noh play for summer which deals with a love romance between a prostitute of Murotsu of Harima Province and a man who lives in Shimogyo district of Kyoto, and also has a highlight scene of insanity, introducing a historical event at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 古くは二段構成であったらしいが、現在は中入りなしの一段構成で上演される。
sen.e: Formerly it seemed to be performed in a two-stage formation but now it is performed in a single-stage formation without intermission.
Formerly it seemed to be performed in a two-stage formation but now it is performed in a single-stage formation without intermission.
Formerly it seemed to be performed in a two-stage formation but now it is performed in a single-stage formation without intermission.

sen.j: 下京の男が登場し、下鴨神社参拝の途上、神社で行われている夏越の祓いで、若い女が茅の輪くぐりをすすめていることを聞くところから能ははじまる。
sen.e: The Noh starts with a scene that a man of Shimogyo appears and hears on his way to visit Shimogamo-jinja Shrine that a young woman is inviting visitors to try chinowa kuguri (passing through a hoop made of kaya grass [plants of sedge family]) at Nagoshi-no-harai festival which is going on at the shrine.
sen.cmt: 日本語には「茅の輪くぐりをすすめている」の目的語がないので、参拝客（visitors）を追加しました。
sen.e: The Noh starts with a scene that a man of Shimogyo appears and hears on his way to visit Shimogamo-jinja Shrine that a young woman is inviting visitors to try chinowa kuguri (passing through a hoop made of kaya grass [plants of sedge family]) at Nagoshi-no-harai festival which is going on at the shrine.

The Noh starts with a scene that a man of Shimogyo appears and hears on his way to visit Shimogamo-jinja Shrine that a young woman is inviting visitors to try chinowa kuguri (passing through a hoop made of kaya grass [plants of sedge family]) at Nagoshi-no-harai festival which is going on at the shrine.

sen.j: 【登場人物】
sen.e: Characters
Characters
Characters

sen.j: 能シテ 室津の女
sen.e: Noh shite (a main role): a woman of Murotsu
Noh shite (a main role): a woman of Murotsu
Noh shite (a main role): a woman of Murotsu

sen.j: 能ワキ 下京の男
sen.e: Noh waki (a supporting role): a man of Shimogyo
Noh waki (a supporting role): a man of Shimogyo
Noh waki (a supporting role): a man of Shimogyo

sen.j: 能狂言 所の者
sen.e: Nohkyogen: a local man
sen.cmt: 「ところのもの」は以下の文脈から 'a local man'と解釈しました。
sen.e: Nohkyogen: a local man
Nohkyogen: a local man

sen.j: 下京の男が登場、下記のように述べる。
sen.e: A man of Shimogyo appears and says as follows.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 男のセリフが2つありましたので、「下記のように述べる」として分割しました。
sen.e: A man of Shimogyo appears and says as follows.
A man of Shimogyo appears and says as follows.

sen.j: 「播磨の国で室津の遊女と知り合い、必ず妻にすると約束して京に帰ったが、時を経て女を迎えにやったところ、すでにその地にいないといわれた。」
sen.e: I met a prostitute of Murotsu in Harima Province and returned to Kyoto after promising to marry her, and after for a while I sent for her but heard that she was not there.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: I met a prostitute of Murotsu in Harima Province and returned to Kyoto after promising to marry her, and after for a while I sent for her but heard that she was not there.'
I met a prostitute of Murotsu in Harima Province and returned to Kyoto after promising to marry her, and after for a while I sent for her but heard that she was not there.'

sen.j: 「賀茂の明神に参拝して再会を願おう。」
sen.e: I'll visit Kamo-no-myojin Shrine and pray to see her again.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: I'll visit Kamo-no-myojin Shrine and pray to see her again.'
I'll visit Kamo-no-myojin Shrine and pray to see her again.'

sen.j: そこに所の者がやってきたので｢近頃珍しいことはないか｣と問う。
sen.e: Just then a local man came so he asked, 'Is there anything new recently?'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 下段に、＜」と答える。＞ だけがありましたのでこの欄に含みましたが、ここでは二文ありますので、結局分割しました。「と問えば」となって次の文が続いていましたが、「と問う。」でこの欄を終わらせ、所の者の答えを次欄に入れて、「と答える」としました。
sen.e: Just then a local man came so he asked, 'Is there anything new recently?'
Just then a local man came so he asked, 'Is there anything new recently?'

sen.j: ｢若い女が巫女のようななりをして、水無月祓いに茅の輪をくぐれとすすめている」と答える。
sen.e: The man answers, 'A young woman dressed like a shrine maiden invites visitors to try chinowa-kuguri (passing through a hoop made of kaya grass [plants of sedge family]) at Minazuki Harai festival.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 「茅の輪をくぐれとすすめている」の目的語（誰にすすめるのか）がないのでvisitors（参拝客）を加えました。
sen.e: The man answers, 'A young woman dressed like a shrine maiden invites visitors to try chinowa-kuguri (passing through a hoop made of kaya grass [plants of sedge family]) at Minazuki Harai festival.'
The man answers, 'A young woman dressed like a shrine maiden invites visitors to try chinowa-kuguri (passing through a hoop made of kaya grass [plants of sedge family]) at Minazuki Harai festival.'

sen.j: ほどなく下鴨神社に到着、そこへ例の若い女が登場する。
sen.e: In a while he arrives at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and there appears the young woman.
In a while he arrives at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and there appears the young woman.
In a while he arrives at Shimogamo-jinja Shrine and there appears the young woman.

sen.j: 狂女の出立ちで手に茅の輪をもち、木綿襷をかけている。
sen.e: Looking like a mad woman, she has a cogon grass ring in her hand and yudasuki (cotton cord used to tuck up the sleeves of a kimono) on her shoulders.
Looking like a mad woman, she has a cogon grass ring in her hand and yudasuki (cotton cord used to tuck up the sleeves of a kimono) on her shoulders.
Looking like a mad woman, she has a cogon grass ring in her hand and yudasuki (cotton cord used to tuck up the sleeves of a kimono) on her shoulders.

sen.j: 女は｢思う人を慕って都にのぼってきた｣と謡う。
sen.e: The woman sings, 'I came up to Miyako following my sweetheart.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 「女は｢思う人を慕って都にのぼってきた｣と謡い、恋路をただす神ならば．．．」と続いていましたので、二文に分けました。
sen.e: The woman sings, 'I came up to Miyako following my sweetheart.'
The woman sings, 'I came up to Miyako following my sweetheart.'

sen.j: ｢恋路をただす神ならばなどか逢瀬のなかるべき（糺の森にいます神様の前でならどうして思う人との再会がないななどということがあるだろうか）｣と物狂いの風体をしめす。
sen.e: She shows insane looks, singing 'As I'm here with the God who lives in Tadasu-no-Mori forest, I'm sure I can meet my sweetheart again.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She shows insane looks, singing 'As I'm here with the God who lives in Tadasu-no-Mori forest, I'm sure I can meet my sweetheart again.'
She shows insane looks, singing 'As I'm here with the God who lives in Tadasu-no-Mori forest, I'm sure I can meet my sweetheart again.'

sen.j: 所の者は、｢さっき言っていたのは、あの女のことですよ｣と告げる。
sen.e: The local man says, 'It is that woman that I talked about earlier.'
The local man says, 'It is that woman that I talked about earlier.'
The local man says, 'It is that woman that I talked about earlier.'

sen.j: 下京の男は｢夏越の祓のいわれを聞きたい｣と女に言葉をかける。
sen.e: The man of Shimojo talks to her, 'I want to hear the story of Nagoshi no harai.'
The man of Shimogyo talks to her, 'I want to hear the story of Nagoshi no harai.'
The man of Shimogyo talks to her, 'I want to hear the story of Nagoshi no harai.'

sen.j: 女はいわれを語り、能地謡の｢水無月の夏越の祓いする人は千歳の命延ぶと聞け｣というコーラスにひきつがれる。
sen.e: The woman tells the story followed by chorus of Noh-jiutai (Noh chorus), 'They say that those who perform Nagoshi no harai in June can live longer than their 1,000-year lifespan.'
The woman tells the story followed by chorus of Noh-jiutai (Noh chorus), 'They say that those who perform Nagoshi no harai in June can live longer than their 1,000-year lifespan.'
The woman tells the story followed by chorus of Noh-jiutai (Noh chorus), 'They say that those who perform Nagoshi no harai in June can live longer than their 1,000-year lifespan.'

sen.j: 女は男のさしだした烏帽子をかぶり、｢加茂川の後瀬静かに後も逢わん（加茂川が合流する地点であるこの地で恋する人と出会おう）｣と舞いはじめる。
sen.e: She puts on eboshi (formal headwear for court nobles) offered by the man and begins to dance to the tune 'I'll meet my sweetheart at this place where the River Kamo joins.'
She puts on eboshi (formal headwear for court nobles) offered by the man and begins to dance to the tune 'I'll meet my sweetheart at this place where the River Kamo joins.'
She puts on eboshi (formal headwear for court nobles) offered by the man and begins to dance to the tune 'I'll meet my sweetheart at this place where the River Kamo joins.'

sen.j: 舞は佳境にいたり、地謡の｢賀茂のやしろにすごすごと、歩みよるべの水のあや（中略）倒れふしてぞなきいたる｣で、女は倒れ伏す。
sen.e: The dance comes to the climax and she falls down when the Jiutai sings, 'Walking along the shore to Kamo Shrine with a heavy heart, I fell down and wept.'
The dance comes to the climax and she falls down when the Jiutai sings, 'Walking along the shore to Kamo Shrine with a heavy heart, I fell down and wept.'
The dance comes to the climax and she falls down when the Jiutai sings, 'Walking along the shore to Kamo Shrine with a heavy heart, I fell down and wept.'

sen.j: 男はそれを見て「これは別れたわが妻の衰えた姿だ」と気づく。
sen.e: Seeing it, he notices, 'This is a weakened figure of my wife who I parted from.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 後列が、＜」と気づく。＞だけでしたので、一文に入れました。
sen.e: Seeing it, he notices, 'This is a weakened figure of my wife who I parted from.'
Seeing it, he notices, 'This is a weakened figure of my wife who I parted from.'

sen.j: それに答えて女は｢そのお声は愛する人でしょうか｣と言う。
sen.e: Answering it, she says, 'Is the voice my sweetheart's?'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 後列と一緒になっていましたので、二文にわけました。
sen.e: Answering it, she says, 'Is the voice my sweetheart's?'
Answering it, she says, 'Is the voice my sweetheart's?'

sen.j: ｢夢のようで、ただ心が打ち騒ぐばかりです。｣
sen.e: I feel as if I'm dreaming and just excited.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: I feel as if I'm dreaming and just excited.'
I feel as if I'm dreaming and just excited.'

sen.j: 二人は｢室君の操を知るもこれ糺の御神の御恵みなりと、同じく再び伏し拝み、妹背打ち連れ帰りけり（室津の遊女の操を知ることができたのも、糺の森にいます神のおかげと、伏し拝んで、二人は連れ添ってかえった）｣という地謡で能は終わる。
sen.e: The Noh play ends with a jiuta saying, 'Falling on their knees and praying to the God of the Tadasu-no-Mori forest, the two of them returned home together, believing it was the God's sake that he could know chastity of the prostitute of Murotsu.'

The Noh play ends with a jiuta saying, 'Falling on their knees and praying to the God of the Tadasu-no-Mori forest, the two of them returned home together, believing it was the God's sake that he could know chastity of the prostitute of Murotsu.'

The Noh play ends with a jiuta saying, 'Falling on their knees and praying to the God of the Tadasu-no-Mori forest, the two of them returned home together, believing it was the God's sake that he could know chastity of the prostitute of Murotsu.'
